denver.title: Denver
denver.gettingThere: Fly to Denver International Airport (DEN) — major hub with direct flights from most US cities and international destinations.

essentials.gettingAround: RTD light rail from airport ($10.50). Car rental recommended for mountain trips. Uber/Lyft throughout metro.

boulder.title: Boulder
boulder.tagline: Where the Flatirons Meet Pearl Street
boulder.gettingThere: 45 minutes northwest of Denver via US-36. RTD Flatiron Flyer bus from Denver ($5.25).

essentials.gettingAround: Walk or bike downtown. Car needed for mountain access. Free HOP bus downtown.

aspen.title: Aspen
aspen.gettingThere: Fly to Aspen/Pitkin County Airport (ASE) or drive 4 hours from Denver via I-70 and CO-82.
highlights: Maroon Bells — most photographed peaks in Colorado

essentials.gettingAround: Free RFTA bus system throughout Roaring Fork Valley. Walk downtown. Car for day trips.

vail.title: Vail
vail.tagline: World-Class Skiing in a Bavarian Village
vail.gettingThere: Fly to Eagle County Regional Airport (EGE), 35 min west. Or 2 hours from Denver via I-70.

essentials.gettingAround: Free Vail bus system. Walk Vail Village. Car needed for regional exploring.

breckenridge.title: Breckenridge
breckenridge.tagline: Historic Mining Town Turned Ski Mecca
breckenridge.gettingThere: 1.5 hours from Denver via I-70. Free Summit Stage bus from Frisco.

essentials.gettingAround: Free Summit Stage bus. Walk Main Street. Free gondola ride to Peak 8.

colorado-springs.title: Colorado Springs
colorado-springs.gettingThere: Fly to Colorado Springs Airport (COS) or drive 70 min south from Denver on I-25.
highlights: Garden of the Gods — free park

essentials.gettingAround: Car recommended. Limited bus service. Uber/Lyft available.

estes-park.title: Estes Park
estes-park.tagline: Gateway to Rocky Mountain National Park
estes-park.gettingThere: 90 minutes northwest of Denver via I-25 and US-36. Timed entry reservations required for RMNP in summer.
highlights: Trail Ridge Road — highest continuous paved road in US

essentials.gettingAround: Free Estes Park shuttle in summer. Car needed for park access. RMNP shuttle from Park & Ride.

telluride.title: Telluride
telluride.gettingThere: Fly to Telluride Regional Airport (TEX) or Montrose (MTJ, 65 min). 6+ hours from Denver.
highlights: Bridal Veil Falls — tallest free-falling falls in CO

essentials.gettingAround: Free Galloping Goose transit. Walk downtown. Free gondola to Mountain Village.

durango.title: Durango
durango.gettingThere: Fly to Durango-La Plata County Airport (DRO) or drive 6.5 hours from Denver.

essentials.gettingAround: Walk Main Avenue. Trolley in summer. Car for Mesa Verde and day trips.

steamboat-springs.title: Steamboat Springs
steamboat-springs.tagline: Ski Town USA — Champagne Powder Capital
steamboat-springs.gettingThere: Fly to Yampa Valley Regional Airport (HDN) or drive 3 hours from Denver via I-70.

essentials.gettingAround: Free Steamboat Springs Transit. Walk Old Town. Car for regional access.

denver-aspen.operator: I-70 to CO-82 or United Airlines

denver-durango.operator: I-25 to US-160 or United Airlines

denver-telluride.operator: I-70 to CO-145 or United Airlines

travelTips.currency: US Dollar (USD/$). Credit cards accepted virtually everywhere.
travelTips.altitude: Denver is at 5,280 ft. Mountain towns range 7,000-14,000 ft. Drink extra water and take it easy the first day.
travelTips.bestOverallMonths: June to September for hiking, December to March for skiing. September-October for fall colors.
travelTips.winterDriving: I-70 requires traction law compliance (AWD/4WD or chains) September through May. Check CDOT for road conditions.
travelTips.tpas: Timed Entry Permit required for Rocky Mountain National Park in summer. Reserve at recreation.gov.
travelTips.parking: Many ski towns have free shuttle lots. Park-and-ride is often easier than driving into town.
